borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing dwellinghouse.

<p>No development shall commence until:</p><p>(a) an investigation and risk assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with the planning application, has</p><p>been completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site,</p><p>whether or not it originates on the site. The contents of the scheme are subject to the approval in writing of the</p><p>Local Planning Authority. The investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a</p><p>written report of the findings must be produced. The written report is subject to the approval in writing of the Local</p><p>Planning Authority. The report of the findings must include:</p><p>(i) a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;</p><p>(ii) an assessment of the potential risks to human health; property (existing or proposed) including buildings,</p><p>crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; adjoining land; groundwaters and surface</p><p>waters; ecological systems; archaeological sites and ancient monuments; and</p><p>(iii) an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s).</p><p>This must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model Procedures for the</p><p>Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11’; and</p><p>(b) a detailed remediation scheme, to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing</p><p>unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other property and the natural and historical environment, has</p><p>been prepared and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The scheme must include all</p><p>works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site</p><p>management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A</p><p>of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.</p><p>(c) The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to commencement of</p><p>the development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local</p><p>Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement</p><p>of the remediation scheme works.Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that</p><p>demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced and is subject to the approval in</p><p>writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out to</p><p>demonstrate that the site remediation criteria have been met.</p><p>(d) In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development that</p><p>was not previously identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority. An</p><p>investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a), and where</p><p>remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared in accordance with the requirements of (b),</p><p>which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. Following completion of measures</p><p>identified in the approved remediation scheme a verification report must be prepared, which is subject to the</p><p>approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.</p>

<p>Prior to commencement of the development, a CLP in line with the TfL guidelines</p><p>shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. The details shall</p><p>include the numbers, size and routes of construction vehicles, provisions</p><p>within/around the site to ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction</p><p>works are properly managed to prevent any unwanted disruption to other highway</p><p>users, and other matters relating to traffic management to be agreed with the</p><p>licencing officers of the council. Approved details shall be implemented throughout</p><p>the project period and any changes to the document must be reported back to the</p><p>council’s planning and highways department.</p>

Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no development falling within CLASS XXX in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to that Order shall be carried out without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.
description: Construction of a front porch to the existing house, removal of existing side extension and the construction of a new two storey, 3x bedroom dwellinghouse.

constraints_details.result: 2 Beansland Grove, Chadwell Heath, Romford, RM6 5QH
